0: Washington (CNN) -- An upcoming U.S. visit by Afghanistan President Hamid Karzai could be called off if he continues to make troubling political statements, White House Press Secretary Robert Gibbs said Tuesday. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR President Obama invited Karzai to visit Washington on May 12, but Gibbs said that subsequent "troubling and untruthful remarks" by the Afghan president have raised questions about the value of such a meeting. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The government will evaluate any further Karzai remarks to determine whether the meeting should take place, Gibbs said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Karzai was re-elected president last year in voting that was marred by irregularities and that required a runoff. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR On Friday, Karzai irritated the Obama administration when he blamed the irregularities on foreigners who want a "puppet government" in Afghanistan. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR He further aggravated Washington, his biggest backer, on Sunday when he told a gathering of tribal leaders that the U.S.-led alliance will not move against Taliban fighters in Kandahar "until you say we can." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "I can't speak to why he said those things," Gibbs said. "They're troubling. They are confusing. They've been investigated and found to be untruthful."
